== Installation ==

You have to come from CM10/CM10.1 before installing this.
 1. Reboot into Recovery
 2. Make a Nandroid backup. (  Optional )
 3. WIPE (wipe data/factory reset) Needed to free space on /data or install will silently fail
 4. Flash http://lu4ndr01d.googlecode.com/files/cm-10.1-20130225-UNOFFICIAL-galaxysbmtd.zip
 5. Flash http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-touch-preview/quantal/mwc-demo/quantal-preinstalled-phablet-armhf.zip or Some <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-touch-preview/daily-preinstalled/ | Dailybuilds ]]</nowiki>
 6. Flash http://goo.im/devs/pawitp/galaxysmtd_ubuntu/ubuntu-aries-layout-fix-20130223.zip ( Thanks to Pawitp from xda )
 Dont need, but the default UI is to big, and this make it smaller
 7. Reboot

== How to build it from begin ==

=== Automatic ===
Now is very easy to set up the repository.

Read this: <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Touch/Porting#Enabling_a_new_device | Enablind a new device]]</nowiki>

Just use the galaxysbmtd in place of codename. Now you have your repository set up.

=== MANUAL (DEPRECATED) ===

First need to read this <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Touch/Porting | Porting Ubuntu Touch]]</nowiki>

After you understand this now you can keep reading.

When the initial repo sync are done, you have to edit your:
<pre>
.repo/manifests/default.xml}}}

You should add this lines

{{{
 <project name="CyanogenMod/android_device_samsung_galaxysbmtd" path="device/samsung/galaxysbmtd" remote="github" revision="cm-10.1" />
 <project name="CyanogenMod/android_device_samsung_aries-common" path="device/samsung/aries-common" remote="github" revision="cm-10.1" />
 <project name="CyanogenMod/android_kernel_samsung_aries" path="kernel/samsung/aries" remote="github" revision="cm-10.1" />
 <project name="CyanogenMod/android_hardware_samsung" path="hardware/samsung" remote="github" revision="cm-10.1" />
</pre>

If you want to save some space you can delete the devices.. maguro tuna manta etc..

Now
<pre>
$ repo sync }}}

TIP: Goog thing to do is a:
{{{
/usr/bin/phablet-dev-bootstrap -c <FOLDER> }}}
Because it will do some other stuff that need to be done more than just the sync.

=== Extract blobs ===
Now we have to get the proprietary blobs from Android.

{{{
$ cd device/samsung/galaxysbmtd
$ ./extract-files.sh}}}

Not sure if needed. It seens that the first one already extract this. But it can't harm.
{{{$ cd device/samsung/aries-common
$ ./extract-files.sh
</pre>

=== Patches ===

We need a few extra edits to get it to build corrected.
Thansk to Pawitp he already put this on git. 

Those are the files and patches.

<nowiki>[[ https:--gist.github.com-anonymous-5020455| device-samsung-aries-common ]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[ https:--gist.github.com-anonymous-5020458| hardware-samsung ]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[ https:--gist.github.com-anonymous-5020461| kernel-samsung-aries ]]</nowiki>

Don't forget to commit the changes

=== Build it ===
Now we need to build it.

go back to the original folder of you repo and then
{{{
$ . build/envsetup.sh
$ brunch galaxysbmtd}}}

When the build process over you will have a zip file. 
The location is:
{{{
out/target/product/galaxysbmtd/cm-10.1-XXXXXXXX-UNOFFICIAL-galaxysbmtd.zip}}}
where XXXXXXX is the date!
